Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel; interior glazed black with traces of two bands in added white; exterior: black-figure frieze on dilute line above glazed area: lower parts of three figures to left; on left standing nude figure with shield with added red; centre, draped male with thin spear(?); right figure, off-vertical, nude, but greaved at least on one leg and holding thin spear(?) aslant.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XXI, no. 7)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 442, no. B727)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1778)
